## File Listing

The file content with the documentation metadata removed is:

<ProgramListing>

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp - GPU Load &amp; Store Vectorizer --------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass merges loads/stores to/from sequential memory addresses into vector</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loads/stores.  Although there&#39;s nothing GPU-specific in here, this pass is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// motivated by the microarchitectural quirks of nVidia and AMD GPUs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (For simplicity below we talk about loads only, but everything also applies</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to stores.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass is intended to be run late in the pipeline, after other</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// vectorization opportunities have been exploited.  So the assumption here is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that immediately following our new vector load we&#39;ll need to extract out the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// individual elements of the load, so we can operate on them individually.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// On CPUs this transformation is usually not beneficial, because extracting the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// elements of a vector register is expensive on most architectures.  It&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// usually better just to load each element individually into its own scalar</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// register.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// However, nVidia and AMD GPUs don&#39;t have proper vector registers.  Instead, a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &quot;vector load&quot; loads directly into a series of scalar registers.  In effect,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// extracting the elements of the vector is free.  It&#39;s therefore always</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// beneficial to vectorize a sequence of loads on these architectures.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Vectorizing (perhaps a better name might be &quot;coalescing&quot;) loads can have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// large performance impacts on GPU kernels, and opportunities for vectorizing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// are common in GPU code.  This pass tries very hard to find such</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// opportunities; its runtime is quadratic in the number of loads in a BB.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Some CPU architectures, such as ARM, have instructions that load into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// multiple scalar registers, similar to a GPU vectorized load.  In theory ARM</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// could use this pass (with some modifications), but currently it implements</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// its own pass to do something similar to what we do here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Overview of the algorithm and terminology in this pass:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Break up each basic block into pseudo-BBs, composed of instructions which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    are guaranteed to transfer control to their successors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Within a single pseudo-BB, find all loads, and group them into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    &quot;equivalence classes&quot; according to getUnderlyingObject() and loaded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    element size.  Do the same for stores.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - For each equivalence class, greedily build &quot;chains&quot;.  Each chain has a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    leader instruction, and every other member of the chain has a known</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    constant offset from the first instr in the chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Break up chains so that they contain only contiguous accesses of legal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    size with no intervening may-alias instrs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Convert each chain to vector instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The O(n^2) behavior of this pass comes from initially building the chains.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In the worst case we have to compare each new instruction to all of those</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that came before. To limit this, we only calculate the offset to the leaders</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of the N most recently-used chains.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-h">llvm/Transforms/Vectorize/LoadStoreVectorizer.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/apint-h">llvm/ADT/APInt.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/arrayref-h">llvm/ADT/ArrayRef.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/densemap-h">llvm/ADT/DenseMap.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/mapvector-h">llvm/ADT/MapVector.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/postorderiterator-h">llvm/ADT/PostOrderIterator.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Equivalence class key, the initial tuple by which we group loads/stores.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Loads/stores with different EqClassKeys are never merged.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (We could in theory remove element-size from the this tuple.  We&#39;d just need</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to fix up the vector packing/unpacking code.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#aaee92d4e61ec828be1e2db5a7f63f136"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#aaee92d4e61ec828be1e2db5a7f63f136">EqClassKey</a> =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlight">    std::tuple&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; result of getUnderlyingObject() &#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlight">               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; AddrSpace &#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; Load/Store element size bits &#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlight">               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; IsLoad; char b/c bool can&#39;t be a DenseMap key &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">               &gt;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#a86c909aa61765bb87ce40ba89a523d58"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#91;&#91;maybe&#95;unused&#93;&#93; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">llvm::raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab89f1db02887aa569176f0e29622eb47">operator&lt;&lt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">llvm::raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;OS,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#aaee92d4e61ec828be1e2db5a7f63f136">EqClassKey</a> &amp;K) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;&#91;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/underlyingobject">UnderlyingObject</a>, AddrSpace, ElementSize, IsLoad&#93; = K;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> OS &lt;&lt; (IsLoad ? </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;load&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;store&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">) &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot; of &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/underlyingobject">UnderlyingObject</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">            &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot; of element size &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; ElementSize &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot; bits in addrspace &quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">            &lt;&lt; AddrSpace;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A Chain is a set of instructions such that:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - All instructions have the same equivalence class, so in particular all are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    loads, or all are stores.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - We know the address accessed by the i&#39;th chain elem relative to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    chain&#39;s leader instruction, which is the first instr of the chain in BB</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Chains have two canonical orderings:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - BB order, sorted by Instr-&gt;comesBefore.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Offset order, sorted by OffsetFromLeader.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass switches back and forth between these orders.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/chainelem"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/chainelem/#ab70f33d8dd80be7ec6f48489581e5972">ChainElem</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/chainelem/#ad8a74ae608206d15bec80e9d2285e5f9"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/chainelem/#ad8a74ae608206d15bec80e9d2285e5f9">Inst</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   call assert&#95;array&#95;len(arr.length)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   load arr&#91;1&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Even though assert&#95;arr&#95;len does not read or write any memory, we can&#39;t</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (Don&#39;t be scared by the depth of the loop nest here.  These operations are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// all at worst O(n lg n) in the number of instructions, and splitting chains</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// doesn&#39;t change the number of instrs.  So the whole loop nest is O(n lg n).)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We know that elements in the chain with nonverlapping offsets can&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// alias, but AA may not be smart enough to figure this out.  Use a</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;OffsetFromLeader&#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight">&gt; ChainOffsets;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Loads get hoisted up to the first load in the chain.  Stores get sunk</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// down to the last store in the chain.  Our algorithm for loads is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Take the first element of the chain.  This is the start of a new chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Take the next element of &#96;Chain&#96; and check for may-alias instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    up to the start of NewChain.  If no may-alias instrs, add it to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    NewChain.  Otherwise, start a new NewChain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For stores it&#39;s the same except in the reverse direction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We expect IsLoad to be an std::bool&#95;constant.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Impl = &#91;&amp;&#93;(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IsLoad) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// MSVC is unhappy if IsLoad is a capture, so pass it as an arg.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="651"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Vectorizer::getChainElemTy(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Chain &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="652"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>.empty());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="653"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The rules are:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="654"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - If there are any pointer types in the chain, use an integer type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00655" /><CodeLine lineNumber="655"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Prefer an integer type if it appears in the chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00656" /><CodeLine lineNumber="656"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Otherwise, use the first type in the chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00657" /><CodeLine lineNumber="657"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="658"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The rule about pointer types is a simplification when we merge e.g.  a load</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00659" /><CodeLine lineNumber="659"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of a ptr and a double.  There&#39;s no direct conversion from a ptr to a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="660"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// double; it requires a ptrtoint followed by a bitcast.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="661"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It&#39;s unclear to me if the other rules have any practical effect, but we do</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it to match this pass&#39;s previous behavior.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61d13d6824ec46c31260a4fd0997eda0">any&#95;of</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>, &#91;&#93;(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ChainElem &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00677" /><CodeLine lineNumber="677"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="678"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::vector&lt;Chain&gt; Vectorizer::splitChainByAlignment(Chain &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We use a simple greedy algorithm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Given a chain of length N, find all prefixes that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    (a) are not longer than the max register length, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="682"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    (b) are a power of 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00683" /><CodeLine lineNumber="683"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - Starting from the longest prefix, try to create a vector of that length.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="684"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - If one of them works, great.  Repeat the algorithm on any remaining</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="685"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    elements in the chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - If none of them work, discard the first element and repeat on a chain</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="687"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    of length N-1.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>.empty())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00689" /><CodeLine lineNumber="689"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00690" /><CodeLine lineNumber="690"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="691"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#aff579b5a1d14d2642cec9311568bf9b2">sortChainInOffsetOrder</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="693"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="697"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IsLoadChain = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;LoadInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>&#91;0&#93;.Inst);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> GetVectorFactor = &#91;&amp;&#93;(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> VF, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> LoadStoreSize,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Finally, we need to reorder the instrs in the BB so that the (transitive)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// operands of VecInst appear before it.  To see why, suppose we have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// vectorized the following code:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ptr1  = gep a, 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   load1 = load i32 ptr1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ptr0  = gep a, 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   load0 = load i32 ptr0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We will put the vectorized load at the location of the earliest load in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the BB, i.e. load1.  We get:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ptr1  = gep a, 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   loadv = load &lt;2 x i32&gt; ptr0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   load0 = extractelement loadv, 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   load1 = extractelement loadv, 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ptr0 = gep a, 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Notice that loadv uses ptr0, which is defined &#42;after&#42; it!</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#ae31219d422e76099c3c5dfaa2c7171cb">reorder</a>(VecInst);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If I is in the chain, we can tell whether it aliases ChainIt by checking</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1110"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If both OpA and OpB are adds with NSW/NUW and with one of the operands</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// being the same, we can guarantee that the transformation is safe if we can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1112"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// prove that OpA won&#39;t overflow when Ret added to the other operand of OpA.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  %tmp7 = add nsw i32 %tmp2, %v0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1115"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  %tmp8 = sext i32 %tmp7 to i64</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1117"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  %tmp11 = add nsw i32 %v0, 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  %tmp12 = add nsw i32 %tmp2, %tmp11</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1119"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  %tmp13 = sext i32 %tmp12 to i64</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1120"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1121"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  Both %tmp7 and %tmp12 have the nsw flag and the first operand is %tmp2.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1122"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  It&#39;s guaranteed that adding 1 to %tmp7 won&#39;t overflow because %tmp11 adds</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1123"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  1 to %v0 and both %tmp11 and %tmp12 have the nsw flag.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1124"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(AddOpA-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#ab4e05d690df389b8b1477c90387b575f">getOpcode</a>() == Instruction::Add &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1248"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#a043b2c098b442537523ecb6a194c7ec4">checkNoWrapFlags</a>(OpB, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvptxisellowering-cpp/#ae1a90b5d85643644483b2ca70da4d13faed3fa7a5efe80dad3ea3d86cc14be246">Signed</a>)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1249"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In the checks below a matching operand in OpA and OpB is an operand which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1250"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is the same in those two instructions.  Below we account for possible</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1251"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// orders of the operands of these add instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1252"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MatchingOpIdxA : &#123;0, 1&#125;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1253"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MatchingOpIdxB : &#123;0, 1&#125;)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1261"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Third attempt:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1263"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Assuming IdxDiff is positive: If all set bits of IdxDiff or any higher</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1265"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Diff to it while guaranteeing no overflow of any sort.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1455"><span class="doxyHighlight">        (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a> &amp;&amp; !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a>.isLegalToVectorizeStore(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>)))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1456"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1457"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1458"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad12126a4bea94833696dc67e0431e829">getLoadStoreType</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1459"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vectortype/#aa6a2194fc011669faabe43322d7c6c5f">VectorType::isValidElementType</a>(Ty-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a7c742b32ebcd73d6dc851afac295b0f2">getScalarType</a>()))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1460"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1461"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1462"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Skip weird non-byte sizes. They probably aren&#39;t worth the effort of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1463"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// handling correctly.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1464"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> TySize = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getTypeSizeInBits(Ty);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1465"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((TySize % 8) != 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1466"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1467"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1468"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Skip vectors of pointers. The vectorizeLoadChain/vectorizeStoreChain</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1469"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// functions are currently using an integer type for the vectorized</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1470"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// load/store, and does not support casting between the integer type and a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1471"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// vector of pointers (e.g. i64 to &lt;2 x i16&#42;&gt;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1472"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Ty-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a1bc022868b23918efa44df511f4d5b61">isVectorTy</a>() &amp;&amp; Ty-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#ab03652069eab17006c51f00c261a6a44">isPtrOrPtrVectorTy</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1473"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1474"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1475"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targetlibraryinfo-cpp/#aca185e6d0e9f423dbb24440206454872a11dbf501abf829b3ab7049c2d3a8a053">Ptr</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2922c0c507ccec5bea4642aff9e2e328">getLoadStorePointerOperand</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1476"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AS = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targetlibraryinfo-cpp/#aca185e6d0e9f423dbb24440206454872a11dbf501abf829b3ab7049c2d3a8a053">Ptr</a>-&gt;getType()-&gt;getPointerAddressSpace();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1478"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1479"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> VF = VecRegSize / TySize;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1480"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vectortype">VectorType</a> &#42;VecTy = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;VectorType&gt;</a>(Ty);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1481"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1482"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Only handle power-of-two sized elements.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1483"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((!VecTy &amp;&amp; !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a6dec2b5d3e04b47adf4d918d678e81c9">isPowerOf2&#95;32</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getTypeSizeInBits(Ty))) ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1484"><span class="doxyHighlight">        (VecTy &amp;&amp; !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a6dec2b5d3e04b47adf4d918d678e81c9">isPowerOf2&#95;32</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getTypeSizeInBits(VecTy-&gt;getScalarType()))))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1485"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1486"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1487"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No point in looking at these if they&#39;re too big to vectorize.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1488"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (TySize &gt; VecRegSize / 2 ||</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1548"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Compare each instruction in &#96;instrs&#96; to leader of the N most recently-used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1549"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// chains.  This limits the O(n^2) behavior of this pass while also allowing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1550"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// us to build arbitrarily long chains.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1551"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> : Instrs) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1552"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">constexpr</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxChainsToTry = 64;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1563"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#96;Offset&#96; might not have the expected number of bits, if e.g. AS has a</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1591"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1592"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::optional&lt;APInt&gt; Vectorizer::getConstantOffset(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;PtrA, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;PtrB,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1596"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;, PtrB=&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; &#42;PtrB &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;, ContextInst= &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; &#42;ContextInst</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1598"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We&#39;ll ultimately return a value of this bit width, even if computations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1599"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// happen in a different width.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1600"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> OrigBitWidth = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getIndexTypeSizeInBits(PtrA-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a0344a49526443edf90cc0aef3abd3337">getType</a>());</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1606"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NewPtrBitWidth != <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getTypeStoreSizeInBits(PtrB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a0344a49526443edf90cc0aef3abd3337">getType</a>()))</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1609"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we have to shrink the pointer, stripAndAccumulateInBoundsConstantOffsets</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1610"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// should properly handle a possible overflow and the value should fit into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1611"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the smallest data type used in the cast/gep chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1612"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(OffsetA.getSignificantBits() &lt;= NewPtrBitWidth &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1613"><span class="doxyHighlight">         OffsetB.getSignificantBits() &lt;= NewPtrBitWidth);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1614"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1615"><span class="doxyHighlight">  OffsetA = OffsetA.sextOrTrunc(NewPtrBitWidth);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1616"><span class="doxyHighlight">  OffsetB = OffsetB.sextOrTrunc(NewPtrBitWidth);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1617"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (PtrA == PtrB)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1618"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (OffsetB - OffsetA).sextOrTrunc(OrigBitWidth);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1619"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1620"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Try to compute B - A.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1621"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;DistScev = SE.getMinusSCEV(SE.getSCEV(PtrB), SE.getSCEV(PtrA));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1622"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (DistScev != SE.getCouldNotCompute()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1623"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;LSV: SCEV PtrB - PtrA =&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; &#42;DistScev &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;\\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1624"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> DistRange = SE.getSignedRange(DistScev);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1625"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (DistRange.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a91cf2c952ea87d701fe608fe4aaabfe4">isSingleElement</a>()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1626"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Handle index width (the width of Dist) != pointer width (the width of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1627"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the Offset&#42;s at this point).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1628"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> Dist = DistRange.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a1d705f2b7894d43bae1ff46eaf600181">getSingleElement</a>()-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a9b5fc98b47d44d1150d3610bdfab1430">sextOrTrunc</a>(NewPtrBitWidth);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1629"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (OffsetB - OffsetA + Dist).<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a9b5fc98b47d44d1150d3610bdfab1430">sextOrTrunc</a>(OrigBitWidth);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1630"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1631"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1632"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (std::optional&lt;APInt&gt; Diff =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1633"><span class="doxyHighlight">          getConstantOffsetComplexAddrs(PtrA, PtrB, ContextInst, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06afe578efb7ca235af77fb0eef7edcf639">Depth</a>))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1634"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (OffsetB - OffsetA + Diff-&gt;sext(OffsetB.getBitWidth()))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1635"><span class="doxyHighlight">        .sextOrTrunc(OrigBitWidth);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1636"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::nullopt;</span></CodeLine>
